info.game_comments:
2001 Teen Tournament final game 2.
From the Pennsylvania Convention Center in Philadelphia.

jeopardy_round: THE KIDS LOVE THAT ROCK & ROLL

(1, 1).clue: A statue of King Kamehameha I stands guard outside the judiciary building in this capital city

(2, 1).clue: Livestock successfully stage rebellion, pigs end up blowing it for everyone

(3, 1).clue: The appendage seen here gives this variety of snake its name

(4, 1).clue: A1, Take That & the Spice Girls are all musical acts from this country

(5, 1).clue: This hot dog condiment is basically chopped sweet pickles

(6, 1).clue: Headgear for a king, or part of a tooth

(1, 2).clue: From 1701 to 1875 New Haven & this city were twin capitals of Connecticut; today it's the only one

(2, 2).clue: Title guy shipwrecks, ends up on 28-year island getaway, makes a friend, goes home

(3, 2).clue: Snakes are found naturally on every continent except this one

(4, 2).clue: Of King Ad Rock, Thugmuffin C, MCA or Mike D, the one who's not a member of the Beastie Boys

(5, 2).clue: The "Kid' seen here represents these snacks

(6, 2).clue: It "goes before a fall" & before "Prejudice" in a Jane Austen title

(1, 3).clue: The capitol building in this city was designed by Thomas Jefferson

(2, 3).clue: 2 guys dream of owning a farm, one kills the boss' daughter-in-law, then his pal kills him

(3, 3).clue: There are king & Asian species of this "charming" snake seen here

(4, 3).clue: In 1998 Will Smith was "Gettin'" to the No. 1 spot on the charts with this song

(5, 3).clue: Chicken chunks & chopped veggies in a rich sauce topped with a pastry crust are baked in this "pie"

(6, 3).clue: It's the zodiac sign symbolized by a ram

(1, 4).clue: The French called a land formation La Petite Roche, thus giving this capital its name

(2, 4).clue: Frenchman swipes some bread, gets 19 years, gets out, gets pursued by a cop who dies

(3, 4).clue: This highly venomous snake of the eastern U.S. has red & black bands separated by yellow ones

(4, 4).clue: That "Fly" band Sugar Ray is led by this heartthrob lead singer

(5, 4).clue: Part of a British breakfast, this jam is made from bitter Seville oranges, including the rinds

(6, 4).clue: Soup's on! & we need this long-handled spoon or scoop to serve it

(1, 5).clue: This state capital is in the Green Mountains along the Winooski River

(2, 5).clue: Con man checks into mental hospital to avoid prison farm, meets nasty nurse, doesn't check out

(3, 5).clue: The name of this deadly mottled brown snake of the tropics is from the French for "lance head"

(4, 5).clue: Known for '80s hits like "The Reflex" & "Hungry Like the Wolf", this band charted in the '90s with "Come Undone"

(5, 5).clue: The French have Catherine de Medici to thank for introducing this sprouting Italian veggie to them

(6, 5).clue: It can be an object from the past, or a personal item associated with a saint

(1, 1).clue: He was the only U.S. president to die in the 18th century

(3, 1).clue: Like voters in the USA, young women seeking to compete in the Miss Thailand contest must be at least this age

(4, 1).clue: Not even a wheelchair & voice synthesizer can stop him from unlocking the secrets of the universe

(5, 1).clue: Chicago's United Center & Salt Lake City's Delta Center are named for this type of business

(6, 1).clue: An informal talk about flying mammals

(1, 2).clue: This former general was the first Republican to serve 2 full terms as president

(2, 2).clue: Brooke Shields & Lucy Lawless played Rizzo in the '90s revival of this rockin' high school musical

(3, 2).clue: The 100-member Asian Youth Orchestra recently played to rave reviews in this South Korean capital

(4, 2).clue: In 1610 this Italian made his biggest discovery: the 4 largest moons of Jupiter

(5, 2).clue: This Disney-owned baseball team plays at Anaheim's Edison International Field

(6, 2).clue: Small vessel for shipping a nanny or a billy

(1, 3).clue: This Mexican War hero & winning 1848 candidate had never voted for president before

(2, 3).clue: R&B sensation Stephanie Mills was a teenager when she eased on down the road in this role in "The Wiz"

(3, 3).clue: Young actors like Rani Mukherjee perform in movies in "Bollywood" in this populous Asian country

(4, 3).clue: This "Father of Genetics" is the subject of the biography "The Monk in the Garden"

(5, 3).clue: This team that won a championship in 2001 plays in PSINet Stadiun

(1, 4).clue: In 1950 he threatened a music critic who had unkind words for daughter Margaret's singing

(2, 4).clue: The Jets & the Sharks are teenage gangs in this 1957 musical that features the song "Tonight"

(3, 4).clue: With songs like "Fly Away", rock star Cui Jian is one of the leading pop musicians from this Asian country

(4, 4).clue: At the Pantheon in Paris in 1851, he demonstrated the Earth's rotation using his famous pendulum

(5, 4).clue: Now that this city's Civic Arena is the Mellon Arena, its citizens can be full of Mellon pride

(6, 4).clue: The $1.99 lamb as opposed to the $19.99 one

(1, 5).clue: His 1791 marriage to Rachel Robards was invalid, so they had to do it all over again on January 17, 1794

(2, 5).clue: Zaneeta Shinn, a character in this musical, is the teenage daughter of the mayor of River City

(3, 5).clue: With a 6-wicket victory over Nepal, Bangladesh recently retained the Asian youth championship in this sport

(4, 5).clue: He was doing research on influenza when he accidentally discovered penicillin
